subject: ONE WITH GOD:
verse:
The Lord formed me from the beginning, before He created
anything else. I was appointed in ages past, as the very first,  before the earth began. I was born before the oceans were created, before the springs bubbled forth their waters. (Proverbs 8:22-24)
reflection:
God says wisdom is primary and fundamental. It is the
foundation on which all life is built. Paul and John in the N. T. alluded to Solomon’s statements about wisdom to describe Christ’s presences at the creation of the world. (John 17:5, 24) Let us always seek first God Kingdom and His righteousness and this 'wisdom' will be added unto us.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help us to remember that each day, Your creation deserves the praise of all people. Amen!
original_content:
message_id: 17a5fce8dafc224d
subject   : Subject: ONE WITH GOD: (Please read Pro. 8:22-26)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 30 Jun 2021 21:03:30 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*My Verses:*

* The Lord formed me from the beginning, before He created*

*anything else. I was appointed in ages past, as the very first, *

*before the earth began. I was born before the oceans were*

*created, before the springs bubbled forth their waters.*

(Pro. 8:22-24)



*Today’s Reflection:*

God says wisdom is primary and fundamental. It is the

foundation on which all life is built. Paul and John in the

N. T. alluded to Solomon’s statements about wisdom to

describe Christ’s presences at the creation of the world.

(Jn.17:5, 24) Let us always seek first God Kingdom and

His righteousness and this 'wisdom' will be added unto us.

* Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, help us to remember that each*

*day, Your creation deserves the praise of all people. *

* Amen!*

subject: FOUNDATION FOR TRUE WISDOM
verse: Fear of the Lord is the beginning of true wisdom knowledge of the Holy One results in understand ing. (Proverbs 9:10)
reflection:
Are you a mocker or a wise person? You can tell
by the way you respond to criticism. Instead of
replying with a quick put-down or a clever retort
when being rebuked, listen to what is being said.
Learn from your critics, this id the path to wisdom.
Wisdom begins with knowing God. He gives
insight into living because He created life. To
know God you must not just know the facts about
Him;
you must have a personal relationship with
Him.
Do you really want to be wise? Get to know
God better and better. (see James 1:5) for more on
how to get to know Him better.
prayer: My prayer is to gain a personal relationship with You my loving Heavenly Father. Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17a64310105b216e
subject   : Subject: FOUNDATION FOR TRUE WISDOM
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 1 Jul 2021 17:29:31 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
* (Ple*ase read Pro. 9:7-10)

*My Verse:*

*Fear of the Lord is the beginning of true wisdom*

*knowledge of the Holy One results in understand-*

*ing. *(Pro. 9:10)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Are you a mocker or a wise person? You can tell

by the way you respond to criticism. Instead of

replying with a quick put-down or a clever retort

when being rebuked, listen to what is being said.

Learn from your critics, this id the path to wisdom.

Wisdom begins with knowing God. He gives

insight into living because He created life. To

know God you must not just know the facts about

Him; you must have a personal relationship with

Him. Do you really want to be wise? Get to know

God better and better. (see James 1:5) for more on

how to get to know Him better.

*Pastor Sather*

*My prayer is to gain a personal relationship with*

*You my loving Heavenly Father. Amen.*

subject: FOLLOWING GOD'S PATTERN
verse: Ill-gotten gain has no lasting value, but right living  can save your life. (Proverbs 10:2)
reflection:
Some people bring unhappiness on themselves by
choosing ill gotten gain. For example, craving satis faction, they may do something that destroys their
chances of ever achieving their happiness. God’s
principles for right living brings lasting happiness,
because they guide us into long-term right behavior
in spite of our ever changing feelings.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father guide me in the principles You choose that every Christian follow. Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17a690edb1aaa196
subject   : Subject: FOLLOWING GOD'S PATTERN
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 2 Jul 2021 16:10:19 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*Ill-gotten gain has no lasting value, but right living *

*can save your life. *(Pro. 10:2)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Some people bring unhappiness on themselves by

choosing ill gotten gain. For example, craving satis-

faction, they may do something that destroys their

chances of ever achieving their happiness. God’s

principles for right living brings lasting happiness,

because they guide us into long-term right behavior

in spite of our ever changing feelings.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father guide me in the principles *

*You choose that every Christian follow. **Amen. *

subject: SORTING OUT GENERAL TRUTHS
verse:
Lazy people are soon poor; hard workers get rich. A wise youth works hard all summer; a youth who sleeps away the hour of opportunity brings shame.
(Proverbs 10:4-5)
reflection:
We all know that every day has 24 hours filled with
opportunities to grow, serve, and be productive. Yet
it is so easy to waste time, letting life slip from our
grasp.
We need to refuse to be a lazy person, sleeping
or frittering away the hours meant for productive
work.
Let us see time as God’s gift, and see our opp ortunities to live diligently for Him.
prayer: Dear Lord guide us in the ways that give true mean- ing to righteous living. Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17a6df7cff50d7ac
subject   : Subject: SORTING OUT GENERAL TRUTHS
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 3 Jul 2021 15:03:15 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
(Please read Pro. 10:4-9)



*My Verses:*

*Lazy people are soon poor; hard workers get rich.*

*A wise youth works hard all summer; a youth who*

*sleeps away the hour of opportunity brings shame.*

(Pro. 10:4-5)



*Today’s Reflection:*

We all know that every day has 24 hours filled with

opportunities to grow, serve, and be productive. Yet

it is so easy to waste time, letting life slip from our

grasp. We need to refuse to be a lazy person, sleeping

or frittering away the hours meant for productive

work. Let us see time as God’s gift, and see our opp-

ortunities to live diligently for Him.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord guide us in the ways that give true mean-*

*ing to righteous living. **Amen. *

subject: IMPORTANCE OF PROPER SPEECH
verse: To hide hatred is to be a liar, to slander is a fool. Don’t talk to much, for it fosters sin. Be sensible and turn off the flow. (Proverbs 10:18, 19)
reflection:
By hating another person you may become a liar or a fool.
If you try to conceal your hatred, you end up lying. If you
slander the other person and are proven wrong, you are a
fool.
The only way out is to admit your hateful feelings to
God.
Ask Him to change your heart., to help you love in stead of hate. What you say and what you don’t say are equally important. To use proper speech you must not only
say the right words at the right time but also not say what
you should’t
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, before I speak, I ask, is what I want to say true? Is it kind? Please bridle my tongue. Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17a7350873005e2d
subject   : Subject: IMPORTANCE OF PROPER SPEECH
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 4 Jul 2021 15:58:15 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*To hide hatred is to be a liar, to slander is a fool. Don’t*

*talk to much, for it fosters sin. Be sensible and turn off*

*the flow. *(Pro. 10:18, 19)



*Today’s Reflection:*

By hating another person you may become a liar or a fool.

If you try to conceal your hatred, you end up lying. If you

slander the other person and are proven wrong, you are a

fool. The only way out is to admit your hateful feelings to

God. Ask Him to change your heart., to help you love in-

stead of hate. What you say and what you don’t say are

equally important. To use proper speech you must not only

say the right words at the right time but also not say what

you shouldn’t

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, before I speak, I ask, is what I*

*want to say true? Is it kind? Please bridle my tongue.*

*Amen.*

subject: BEING GOOD MANAGERS
verse: The blessings of the Lord makes a person rich, and He adds no sorrow with it. (Proverbs 10:22)
reflection:
God supplies most people with the personal and
financial abilities to respond to the needs of others.
If we all realize how God has blessed us, and if
we all used our resources to do God’s will, hunger
and poverty would be wiped out. Wealth is a
blessing only if we use it the way God intended.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for the wisdom to manage the blessings you have showered me with. Amen.

===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*The blessings of the Lord makes a person rich,*

*and He adds no sorrow with it. *(Pro. 10:22)



*Today’s Reflection:*

God supplies most people with the personal and

financial abilities to respond to the needs of others.

If we all realize how God has blessed us, and if

we all used our resources to do God’s will, hunger

and poverty would be wiped out. Wealth is a

blessing only if we use it the way God intended.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for the wisdom*

*to manage the blessings you have showered *

*me with. **Amen.*

subject: ALL THING HERE COME TO AN END
verse:
The fears of the wicked will all come true; so will the hopes of  the godly.
Disaster strikes like a cyclone, whirling the wicked away, but the godly have a lasing foundation. (Proverbs 10:24, 25)
reflection: The wicked person dreads death. Those who do not believe in God usually fear death, and with good reason. By contrast, believers desire eternal life and God’s Salvation-their hopes will be rewarded. This verse offers a choice. You can have, either your fears or your hopes come true. You make that choice by rejecting God and living your own way or by accepting God and following Him
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that my footsteps will always be following Your path. Amen.

*the godly. Disaster strikes like a cyclone, whirling the wicked away, but
the godly have a lasing found-ation. *(Pro. 10:24, 25)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The wicked person dreads death. Those who do not believe in

God usually fear death, *and* with good reason. By contrast, believers
desire eternal life and God’s Salvation—their hopes

will be rewarded. This verse offers a choice. You can have,

either your fears or your hopes come true. You make that choice

by rejecting God and living your own way or by accepting God and follow-ing
Him

* Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that my footsteps will always *

*be following Your path. **Amen.*

subject: THE PRISE NO RICHES CAN BUY (Please read
verse: Riches will not help us on the day of judgment,  but right living is a safeguard against death.. . . (Proverbs 11:4)
reflection:
“The day of judgment” refers to when we die or to the time when God settles accounts with all people.
On judgment day each of us will stand alone, accountable for all our deeds. At that time, no amount of riches will buy our reconciliation with God.
prayer: I pray that my love for You and my obedience to You will pay my account in full.

message_id: 17a8333f7ccdd337

*Riches will not help us on the day of judgement, *

*but right living is a safeguard again**st death.. . . *(Pro. 11:4)



*Today’s Reflection: *

*“The day of judgment”* refers to when we die or to the time

when God settles accounts with all people. On judgement

day each of us will stand alone, accountable for all our deeds.

At that time, no amount of riches will buy our reconciliation

with God.

*Pastor Sather*

*I pray that my love for You and my obedience to You will *

*pay my account in full. *

subject: WHAT PATH HAVE YOU TAKEN?
verse: When the wicked die, their hopes all perish, for they rely on  their own feeble strength. God rescues the godly from danger,  but He lets the wicked fall into trouble. (Proverbs 11:7-8)
reflection: These verses like we saw in 10:3, contrast two paths in life but are not intended to apply universally to all people in all circumstances. God’s people are not excluded from problems or struggles. If a person follows God’s wisdom, however , God can rescue him or her from trouble. But, a wicked person will fall into his or her own traps. Even if good people suffer, they can be sure they will ultimately be rescued from eternal death.
prayer: Thank You for the promise to rescue all who believe from eternal death. Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17a8864374f85703
subject   : Subject: WHAT PATH HAVE YOU TAKEN? (Please read Pro. 11:5-8)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 8 Jul 2021 18:11:47 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*My Verses:*

*When the wicked die, their hopes all perish, for they rely on *

*their own feeble strength. God rescues the godly from danger, *

*but He lets the wicked fall into trouble. **(Pro. 11:7-8) *



*Today’s Reflection:*

These verses like we saw in 10:3, contrast two paths in life

*but are not* intended to apply universally to all people in all
circumstances. God’s people are not excluded from problems

or struggles. If a person follows God’s wisdom, *however*, God

can rescue him or her from trouble. *But,* a wicked person will

fall into his or her own traps. Even if good people suffer, they

can be sure they will ultimately be rescued from eternal death.

*Pastor Sather*

*Thank You for the promise to rescue all who believe from *

*eternal death. **Amen.*

subject: LOOSE TONGUES MAKE ENEMIES
verse: Evil words destroy one’s friends; wise discernment  rescues the godly. (Proverbs 11:9)
reflection: The mouth can be used either as a weapon or a tool, hurting relationships or building them up. Sadly, it is often easier to destroy than to build, and most people have received more destructive comments than those that build up. Every person you meet today is either a demolition site or a construction opportunity .Your words will make a difference. Will they be weapons of destruction or tools for construction?
prayer: Dear heavenly Father, I pray that You would groom my tongue for construction. Amen.
original_content:

===================================================================
*My Verse:*

*Evil words destroy one’s friends; wise discer**ment *

*rescues the godly. *(Pro. 11:9) c



*Today’s Reflection:*

The mouth can be used either as a weapon or a tool, hurting relationships
or building them up. Sadly, it is often easier to destroy than to build,
and most people have received more destructive comments than those that
build up. Every person

you meet today is either a demolition site or a construction

opportunity .Your words will make a differ-ence. Will they

be weapons of destruction or tools for construction?

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear heavenly Father, I pray that You would groom my *

*tongue for construction. **Amen.*

subject: THE WORLD SAYS, SET ASIDE FOR A RAINY DAY
verse: It is possible to give freely and become more wealthy, but  those who are stingy will lose everything. The generous  prosper and are satisfied; those who refresh others will  themselves be refreshed. (Proverbs 11:24-25)
reflection: These verses seem to contradict what the world, who say, “That does not make any sense!” The world says to hold on to as much as possible, but God blesses those who give freely of their possessions, time, and energy, when we give, God supplies us with more so we can give more. In addition, giving helps us gain a right perspective on our possessions. We come to realize they were never ours to begin with, but they were given to us by God to be used to help others. What then do we gain by giving? Freedom from enslavement to our possessions, the joy from helping others, and God’s approval.
prayer: Dear Lord, it is always my wish to have Your approval. Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17a92329f960c9e9
subject   : Subject: THE WORLD SAYS, SET ASIDE FOR A RAINY DAY
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 10 Jul 2021 15:53:49 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
(Pleasee read Pro. 11:24-26)


*My Verses:*

*It is possible to give freely and become more wealthy, but *

*those who are stingy will lose everything. The generous *

*prosper and are satisfied; those who refresh others will *

themselves* be refreshed. *(Pro, 11:24-25)



*Today’s Reflection:*

These verses seem to contradict what the world, who say,

“That does not make any sense!” The world says to hold

on to as much as possible, but God blesses those who give

freely of their possessions, time, and energy, when we give,

God supplies us with more so we can give more. In addition,

giving helps us gain a right perspective on our possessions.

We come to realize they were never ours to begin with, but

they were given to us by God to be used to help others.

What then do we gain by giving? Freedom from enslavement to our
possessions, the joy from helping others, and God’s approval.

* Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord, it is always my wish to have Your approval. *

*Amen.*

subject: THE BLESSINGS OF fAMILY
verse: Trust in your money and down you go! But the godly flourish like leaves in the spring. those who bring trouble to their families inherit only the wind. the fool will be a servant to the wise. (Proverbs 11:28-29)
reflection: One of the greatest resources God give us is the family. Families provide acceptance, encouragement, guidance, and counsel. When bringing trouble on your family--whether through anger, or through an exaggerated desire for indepen-dence--is foolish because you cut yourself off from all they provide. In your family strive for healing, communication, and understanding.
prayer: Dear heavenly Father, where there is unrest in families, I pray that You would bring healing. Amen.

*Today's Verses:*
*Trust in your money and down you go! But the godly*
*flourish like leaves in the spring. those who bring*
*trouble to their families inherit only the wind. the fool*
*will be a servant to the wise. *(Pro. 11:28-29)

*Today's Reflection:*
One of the greatest resources God give us is the family.
Families provide acceptance, encouragement, guidance,
and counsel. When bringing trouble on your family--whether
through anger, or through an exaggerated desire for indepen-dence--is
foolish because you cut yourself off from all they
provide. In your family strive for healing, communication,
and understanding.
*Pastor Sather*
*Dear heavenly Father, where there is unrest in families, I pray that You
would bring healing. Amen.*

subject: ONLY A FOOL IGNORES WISE COUNSEL
verse: The wicked are trapped by their own words, but the godly  escape such trouble. (Proverbs 12:13)
reflection: Evil people twist facts to support their claims. But for those who always tell the truth, the facts-plain and unvarnished give an unshakable defense. If you find that you always have to defend yourself to others, maybe you are not being honest.
prayer: Dear Lord may I always be open to the wisdom of the wise I pray in Jesus name. Amen. Doc 2-a--b

*My Verses:*

*The wicked are trapped by their own words, but the godly *

*escape such trouble. *(Pro. 12:13)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Evil people twist facts to support their claims. But for those

who always tell the truth, the facts—plain and unvarnished—

give an unshakable defense. If you find that you always

have to defend yourself to others, maybe you are not being

honest.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord may I always be open to the wisdom of the wise *

*I pray in Jesus name. **Amen.*



*Doc 2-a--b*

subject: WISE PEOPLE LISTEN TO GOOD ADVISE
verse: Some people make cutting remarks, but the words of the wise bring healing. Truth stands the test of time;  lies are soon exposed. (Proverbs 12:18, 19)
reflection:
When some people are annoyed or insulted, it is natural for them to retaliate. But this solves nothing and only encour ages trouble. Instead ̧ answer slowly and quietly. Your positive response will achieve results. (Proverbs 15:1 says, “A gentle answer turners away wrath. Truth is always timely; it applies today and in the future. Because it is connected with God’s changeless character. Remember the Bible has stood the test of time.
Because God is truth, you can trust His Word to guide you.
prayer: Dear Lord of all grace and mercy I thank You for the greatest gift ever given—the gift of eternal life, through faith in Your risen Son our Lord Jesus Christ. Amen.

subject: NEEDLESS FEAR
verse:
The way of the godly leads to life;
their path does not  lead to death. (Proverbs 12:28)
reflection: For many death is a dark door at the end of life, a passage way to an unknown and feared destiny. But for God’s people, death is a bright pathway to a new and better life. So why do we fear death? Is it fear of the pain we expect, the separ ation from loved ones, or the unknown? God can help us deal with those fears. He has shown us that death is not final but just another step in the eternal life we received when we followed Him.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me accept the end of this life with the assurance of your presence leading the way. Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17ab6a9903e78df8
subject   : Subject: NEEDLESS FEAR
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 17 Jul 2021 17:50:04 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*The way of the godly leads to life; their path does not *

*lead to death. *(Pro. 12:28)



*Today’s Reflection:*

For many death is a dark door at the end of life, a passage-

way to an unknown and feared destiny. But for God’s people,

death is a bright pathway to a new and better life. So why

do we fear death? Is it fear of the pain we expect, the separ-

ation from loved ones, *or* the unknown? God can help us

deal with those fears. He has shown us that death is not

final but just another step in the eternal life we received

when we followed Him.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, help me accept the end of this *

*life with the assurance of your presence leading the way. *

*Amen.*

subject: IMPORTANCE OF SELF CONTROL
verse: Those who control their tongue, will have long life; a quick  retort can ruin everything. (Proverbs 13:3)
reflection: You have not mastered self-control if you do not control what you say. Words can cut and destroy. James recognized this truth when he said, “the tongue is a small thing, but what enormous damage it can do” (James 3:5). If you want to be self-controlled, begin with your tongue. Stop and think before you react or speak. If you can control this small but powerful member, you can control the rest of the body.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for patience so that I will think before I speak. Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17abb6eb3d7c6b33
subject   : Subject: IMPORTANCE OF SELF CONTROL
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 18 Jul 2021 16:03:52 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
(Please read Pro. 13:1-3)



*My Verse:*

*Those who control their tongue, will have long life; a quick *

*retort can ruin everything. *(Pro. 13:3)



*Today’s Reflection:*

You have not mastered self-control if you do not control what

you say. Words can cut and destroy. James recognized this

truth when he said, “the tongue is a small thing, but what

enormous damage it can do” (Jm. 3:5). If you want to be

self-controlled, begin with your tongue. Stop and think before

you react or speak. If you can control this small but

powerful member, you can control the rest of the body.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for patience so that I will *

*think before I speak. **Amen.*

subject: BENEFITS OF GODLY LIVING
verse: Those who are godly hate lies; the wicked come to shame  and disgrace. Godliness helps people all through life,  while the evil are destroyed by their wickedness. (Proverbs 13:5-6)
reflection:
Godly living will safeguard your life.
Every choice for good sets into motion other opportunities for good. Evil choices follow the same pattern, but in the opposite direction. Each decision you make to obey God’s Word will bring a greater sense of order to your life, while each decision to disobey will bring confusion and destruction. The right choices you make reflect your integrity. Obedience brings the greatest safeguard and security.
prayer: I pray that I will always follow your Word so that my live will reflect my love for You. Amen.

*while the evil are destroyed by their wickedness. *(Pro. 13:5-6)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Godly living will safeguard your life. Every choice for good

sets into motion other opportunities for good. Evil choices

follow the same pattern, but in the opposite direction.

Each decision you make to obey God’s Word will bring a

greater sense of order to your life, while each decision to

disobey will bring confusion and destruction. The right

choices you make reflect your integrity. Obedience brings

the greatest safeguard and security.

*Pastor Sather*

*I pray that I will always follow your Word so that my live *

*will reflect my love for You. **Amen.*

subject: THE CAUSE FOR BREAK-DOWNS
verse: People who despise advice will find themselves  n trouble; those who respect it will succeed.  (Proverbs 13:13)
reflection: God created us, knows us, and loves us. It only makes senses, then, to listen to His instructions and do what He says. The Bible is His unfailing word to us. It is like an owner’s-manual for a car. If you obey God’s instructions, you will “run right” and find His kind of power to live. If you ignore them, you will have breakdowns, accidents, and failures.
prayer: Dear Lord, help me remain faithful to Your Word every day. Amen

*n trouble; **those who respect it will succeed. *

*Today’s Reflection*

God created us, knows us, and loves us.

It only makes senses, then, to listen to

His instructions and do what He says. The Bible

is His unfailing word to us. It is like an

owner’s-manual for a car. If you obey

God’s instructions, you will “run right” and

find His kind of power to live. If you ignore

them, you will have break-downs, accidents,

and failures.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord, help me remain faithful to Your *

*Word every **day. **Amen*

subject: EXAMINE ALL INFORMATION CAREFULLY
verse: An unreliable messenger stumbles into trouble,  but a reliable messenger brings healing.  (Proverbs 13:17)
reflection: In Solomon’s day a king had to rely on a mess enger for information about his country. These messengers had to be trustworthy. Inaccurate information could lead to blood shed. Reliable communication is still vital. If the message received is different from the message sent, managers, businesses, and diplomatic relations can all break down. It is important to choose your words well and avoid reacting until you clearly understand what the other person means.
prayer: Dear Lord, remind me to always examine all information carefully before passing it to others. Amen.

(Please read Pro. 13:14-16)


* My Verse:*

*An unreliable messenger stumbles into trouble, *

*but a reliable messenger brings healing. *

(Pro. 13:17)



*Today’s Reflection:*

In Solomon’s day a king had to rely on a mess-

enger for information about his country. These

messengers had to be trustworthy. Inaccurate

information could lead to blood shed. Reliable

communication is still vital. If the message

received is different from the message sent,

managers, businesses, and diplomatic relations

can all break down. It is important to choose

your words well and avoid reacting until you

clearly understand what the other person means.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord, remind me to always examine *

*all information carefully before passing it to *

*others. **Amen.*

subject: FAITHFULNESS IS A VIRTUE
verse: If you ignore criticism, you will end up in poverty  and disgrace; if you accept criticism, you will  be honored. It is pleasant to see dreams come  true, but fools will not turn from evil to attain  them. (Proverbs 13:18, 19)
reflection: Whether a “dream come true” is good or bad depends on the nature of the dream or desire. It is pleasant to achieve worthwhile goals, but all goals are not worth pursuing. When you set your heart on something, you may lose your ability to assess it objectively. With your desire blind ing your judgment, you may proceed with an un wise relationship, a wasteful purchase, or a poor ly conceived plan. Remember faithfulness is a virtue, but stubbornness is not.
prayer: Dear Lord, please remove any stubbornness that plagues my mind. Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17acfdd0e2ced56f
subject   : Subject: FAITHFULNESS IS A VIRTUE
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 22 Jul 2021 15:16:49 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*If you ignore criticism, you will end up in poverty *

*and disgrace; if you accept criticism, you will *

*be honored. It is pleasant to see dreams come *

*true, but fools will not turn from evil to attain *

*them. *(Pro. 13:18, 19)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Whether a “dream come true” is good or bad

depends on the nature of the dream or desire.

It is pleasant to achieve worth-while goals, but

all goals are not worth pursuing. When you set

your heart on something, you may lose your ability

to assess it objectively. With your desire blind-

ing your judgement, you may proceed with an un-

wise relationship, a wasteful purchase, or a poor-

ly conceived plan. *Remember* faithfulness is

a virtue, but stubbornness is not.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord, please remove any stubbornness *

*that plagues my mind. **Amen. *

subject: CHOOSING WISE GODLY FRIENDS
verse: Whoever walks with the wise will become  wise; whoever walks with fools will suffer  harm. Trouble chases sinners, while blessings  chase the righteous. (Proverbs 13:20, 21)
reflection:
When most people seek advise, they go to their friends first because friends accept them and usually agree with them.
But that is why they may not be able to help them with difficult problems. Our friends are so much like us they may not have the answers we haven’t already heard.
Instead, we should seek out older wiser people to advise us. Wise people have experienced a lot of life-and have succeed ed. They are not afraid to tell the truth. Seek out some wise, godly people who can warn you of the pitfalls ahead.
prayer: Dear Lord, I pray for the wisdom to seek out wise godly people for the advice I need to succeed in life. Amen.
original_content:

*Today’s Verses:*

*Whoever walks with the wise will become *

*wise; whoever walks with fools will suffer *

*harm. Trouble chases sinners, while blessings *

*chase the righteous. *(Pro. 13:20, 21)



*Today’s Reflection:*

When most people seek advise, they go to

their friends first because friends accept them

and usually agree with them. But that is why

they may not be able to help them with

difficult problems. Our friends are so much

like us they may not have the answers we

haven’t already heard. Instead, we should seek

out older wiser people to advise us. Wise people

have experienced a lot of life—and have succeed-

ed. They are not afraid to tell the truth. Seek out

some wise, godly people who can warn you of

the pitfalls ahead.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord, I pray for the wisdom to seek out *

*wise godly people for the advice I need to succeed *

*in life. **Amen. *

subject: JUSTICE THAT WILL NEVER FAIL
verse: A poor person’s farm may produce much food,  but injustice sweeps it away. (Proverbs 13:23)
reflection: The poor are often victims of an unjust society. A poor man’s soil may be good, but unjust laws may rob him of his own produce. This proverb does not take lightly or wink at injustice, it simply describes what often occurs. We should do what we can to fight injustice of every sort. Our efforts may seem inadequate, but it is comforting to know that in the end God’s justice will prevail.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me to not turn the other way when I witness injustice, but voice my concern for the less fortunate. Amen.
original_content:

*Today’s Verse:*

*A poor person’s farm may produce much food, *

*but injustice sweeps it away. *(Pro. 13:23)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The poor are often victims of an unjust society.

A poor man’s soil may be good, *but* unjust laws

may rob him of his own produce. This proverb

does not take lightly or wink at injustice, it

simply describes what often occurs. We should

do what we can to fight injustice of every sort.

Our efforts may seem inadequate, *but* it

is comforting to know that in the end God’s

justice will prevail.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, help me to not turn the *

*other way when I witness injustice, but voice *

*my concern for the less fortunate. **Amen.*

subject: THE NECESSITY OF DISCIPLINE
verse: If you refuse to discipline your children, it proves you don’t  love them, if you love your children, you will be prompt  to discipline them. (Proverbs 13:24)
reflection: It is not easy for a loving parent to discipline a child, but it is necessary. The greatest responsibility God gives parents is the nurture and guidance of their children. The lack of discip line puts parent’s love in question because it shows a lack of concern for the character development of their child ren. Disciplining children averts long-range disaster. With out correction children, grow up with no clear understanding of right and wrong, and with no direction to their lives. Don’t be afraid to discipline your children. It is an act of love. Remember, however, that your efforts can not make your children wise, they can only encourage your children to seek God’s wisdom.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help us to remember to pray that our children have l ooked to you for Your wisdom. Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17adf67069530ba6
subject   : Subject: THE NECESSITY OF DISCIPLINE
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 25 Jul 2021 15:41:49 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*If you refuse to discipline your children, it proves you don’t *

*love them, if you love your children, you will be prompt *

*to discipline them. *(Pro. 13:24)



*Today’s Reflection:*

It is not easy for a loving parent to discipline a child, but it

is necessary. The greatest responsibility God gives parents is

the nurture and guidance of their children. The lack of discip-

line puts parent’s love in question because it shows a lack

of concern for the character development of their child-

ren. Disciplining children averts long-range disaster. With-

out correction children, grow up with no clear understanding

of right and wrong, and with no direction to their lives. Don’t

be afraid to discipline your children. It is an act of love.

Remember, however, that your efforts can not make

your children wise, they can only encourage your children to

seek God’s wisdom.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, help us to remember to pray that our children
have l**ooked
to you for Your wisdom. **Amen.*

subject: HAVE YOU BEEN BARRED FROM WISDOM
verse: A mocker seeks wisdom and never finds it, but knowledge comes easily to those with understanding. (Proverbs 14:6)
reflection: We all know mockers, people who scoff at every word of instruction or advice. They never find wisdom because they don’t seek it seriously. Wisdom comes to those who apply God’s Word to their lives and seek out godly counselors. If the wisdom you seek does not come easily to you, perhaps your attitude is the barrier.
prayer: O Lord of grace and mercy, place within me a Christ-like attitude. Amen.

*My Verse: *

*A mocker seeks wisdom and never finds it, but knowledge comes*

* easily to those with understanding. *(Pro. 14:6)



*Today’s Reflection:*

We all know mockers, people who scoff at every word of instruction

or advice. They never find wisdom because they don’t seek it

seriously. Wisdom comes to those who apply God’s Word to their

lives and seek out godly counselors. If the wisdom you seek does

not come easily to you, perhaps your attitude is the barrier.

*Pastor Sather*

*O Lord of grace and mercy, place within me a Christ-like attitude.*

*Amen. *

subject: JUDGE CAREFULLY---EASY CHOICES
verse: There is a path before each person that seems right,  but it ends in death. (Proverbs 14:12)
reflection: The “path ... that seems right” may offer many options and require few sacrifices. Easy choice, however, should make us take a second look. Is this solution attractive because it allows me to be lazy-because it does not ask me to change my life style-because it requires no moral restraints? The right choice often requires hard work and self-sacrifice. Don’t be enticed by apparent shortcuts that seem right but end in death.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would be found faithful in following the path that Your Holy Spirit sets before me. Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17aef0092a7115a1
subject   : Subject: JUDGE CAREFULLY---EASY CHOICES
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>

===================================================================

*Today’s Verse:*

*There is a path before each person that seems right, *

*but it ends in death. *(Pro. 14:12)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The “path *…* that seems right” may offer many options and

require few sacrifices. Easy choice, however, should make us

take a second look. Is this solution attractive because it allows

me to be lazy—because it does not ask me to change my life-

style—because it requires no moral restraints? The right choice

often requires hard work and self-sacrifice. Don’t be enticed

by apparent short-cuts that seem right but end in death.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would be found faithful *

*in following the path that Your Holy Spirit sets before me.*

*Amen.*

subject: SEEK THE CAUSE OF A QUICK TEMPER
verse:
Those who control their anger have great understanding; those with a hasty temper will make mistakes.
(Proverbs 14:29)
reflection:
A nasty and quick temper can be like a fire out of control.
It can burn us and everyone else in its path. Anger divides people. It pushes us into hasty decisions that only cause bitterness and guilt. Yet anger, in itself, is not wrong. Anger can be a legitimate reaction to injustice and sin. When you feel yourself getting angry, look for the cause. Are you reacting to an evil situation that you are going to set right? Or are you responding selfishly to a personal insult? Pray that God will help you control a quick temper, changing your feelings into effective action and conquering selfish anger through humility and repen tance.
prayer: Dear Lord, when I feel that I am losing my temper, please step in and help me bring it under control. Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17af41045df42ed4
subject   : Subject: SEEK THE CAUSE OF A QUICK TEMPER
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 29 Jul 2021 15:59:05 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Those who control their anger have great understanding;*

*those with a hasty temper will make mistakes.*

(Pro. 14:29)



*Today’s Reflection:*

A nasty and quick temper can be like a fire out of control.

It can burn us and everyone else in its path. Anger divides

people. It pushes us into hasty decisions that *only* cause

bitterness and guilt. Yet anger, in itself, is not wrong. Anger

can be a legitimate reaction to injustice and sin. When you

feel yourself getting angry, look for the cause. Are you reacting

to an evil situation that you are going to set right? Or are you

responding selfishly to a personal insult? Pray that God will help

you control a quick temper, changing your feelings into effective

action and conquering selfish anger through humility and repen-

tance.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord, when I feel that I am losing my temper, please step *

*in and help me bring it under control. **Amen.*
